poem:
Title: "In the Teeth of Tempests"

On eastern shores where frost and fervour dwell,
Zelenskiy spits defiance at the squall. 
"Even the bear can learn anew of law,"
he cries, his words, like tacit bells, will toll.
Upon a battlefield, crowned with wolf's bane,
he whispers to the winter's biting gale,
"Aggression frozen, harmony regained,
One day, may peace within our hearts prevail."
